Evaluation_Questions: How well did this course, to the extent promised in the syllabus, enable “conversation across lines of difference,” integrate practical and theoretical concerns, or consider and integrate issues of class, gender/sexuality, race/ethnicity, dis/ability, and or global/cultural diversity
Comments_Questions: What were the strengths and weaknesses of your Teaching Fellow as an instructor and how might his/her teaching be improved
What was the name of your practicum instructor
What were her/his strengths or weaknesses
Comments_List: Ryan did an excellent job communicating to us and making himself available. His comments on my midterm case study were substantial, thorough, sensitive, and helpful. I appreciate all that he did for us over the course of the semester. The section meetings for this course were optional and I did not take advantage of them. I regret not doing so, but I am sure they were of great help to those who did.

I thought Ryan did an excellent job engaging with the course outside of normal hours. His willingness to structure office hours and various discussion times was a great resource. It also really encouraged me to bring my thoughts outside the classroom and into other settings. If I had to offer one critique: I wish he had joined our in-class conversations more often!

Strength - patient in explaining assignments further
Weaknesses - none
Ryan was always available and offered valuable feedback on all assignments.  Nothing to improve in my opinion.  I wish he could be my Teaching Fellow in all of my classes.
Ryan made himself available and was very clear in discussing the expectations for assignments, as well as helping to clarify content in class.
Ryan's written feedback is in-depth and insightful, and he was very helpful in discussing paper/case study structure and ideas.

No perceived weaknesses. Ryan was available, engaged, and understanding. In addition, he asssesses some of our work and offered critical feedback to help us better engage the course materials and improve our writing.
The tf provided consistent aid throughout the semester.
Ryan was extremely helpful and communicated well with the class.
